page.title: 20R.T.N. Yarns Ltd.
page.content: Roberts,Thorburn and Noble, R.T.N. Yarns Ltd for short is a company that operates in part of a large mill that was built 100 years ago. It employs 325 people. Three quarters of whom are men and one quarter women. Most of the workforce live locally in the Slaithwaite area, and work between 22 and 60 hours a week. The company produces machine knitting yarns from a raw wool which comes from New Zealand and Australia. The wool is first dyed and colour mixed and then spun and wound into yarn. It then goes to customers in the U.S.A., New Zealand, Hong Kong and the U.K. In Britain big chain stores such as Marks and Spencers and British Home Stores take much of the company's products. The company has expanded by 40% over the last five years.
